偷.definition: to steal; to pilfer; to snatch; thief; stealthily

偷偷.definition: stealthily; secretly; covertly; furtively; on the sly

偷加.definition: to surreptitiously add (sth that shouldn't be there)

偷去.definition: to steal; to make off with; stolen

偷吃.definition: to eat on the sly; to pilfer food; to be unfaithful

偷天換日.definition: to engage in fraudulent activities (idiom); skulduggery; to hoodwink people; to cheat sb audaciously

偷工.definition: to skimp on the job; to avoid work

偷工減料.definition: to skimp on the job and stint on materials (idiom); jerry-building; sloppy work

偷師.definition: to steal techniques; to learn secretly from sb else's skills or methods

偷情.definition: to carry on a clandestine love affair

偷惰.definition: to skive off work; to be lazy

偷懶.definition: to goof off; to be lazy

偷拍.definition: to take a picture of a person without permission or without their knowledge

偷梁換柱.definition: lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column; to replace the original with a fake; to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)

偷渡.definition: illegal immigration; to stowaway (on a ship); to steal across the international border; to run a blockade

偷漢.definition: (of a woman) to take a lover

偷漢子.definition: (of a woman) to take a lover

偷看.definition: to peep; to peek; to steal a glance

偷眼.definition: to take a furtive look at

偷空.definition: to take some time out; to make use of a spare moment

偷窺.definition: to peep; to peek; to act as voyeur

偷腥.definition: to cheat on one's spouse; to have an affair

偷襲.definition: to mount a sneak attack; to raid

偷跑.definition: to sneak off; to slip away; (sports) to jump the gun; to make a false start; (fig.) to jump the gun; to start doing sth before it's allowed; (of a movie, game etc) to be leaked before the official release

偷閑.definition: to snatch a moment of leisure; to take a break from work; also written 偷閒|偷闲[tou1 xian2]

偷閒.definition: to snatch a moment of leisure; to take a break from work

偷雞不成蝕把米.pinyin: tōu jī bù chéng shí bǎ mǐ
偷雞不成蝕把米.definition: lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom); fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off; to go for wool and come back shorn

偷雞不著蝕把米.pinyin: tōu jī bù zhù shí bǎ mǐ
偷雞不著蝕把米.definition: see 偷雞不成蝕把米|偷鸡不成蚀把米[tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3]

偷雞摸狗.definition: to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom); to pilfer; to dally with women; to have affairs

偷香竊玉.definition: lit. stolen scent, pilfered jade (idiom); philandering; secret illicit sex
